name: The Knight Templar: Paladin 17/ Monk 1/ Fighter 2
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I find that the power of a Paladin in a lvl 20 environment is quite disturbing, so here is one that will cause nightmares to all evil (or not) foes.

Nothing to say more here, for those of you that you haven't experienced the full power of a buffed Paladin, well-it's quite a sight to behold.

There is only one such build and it is in the old pre-epic ecb archives, "The Lonely Crusader" by non other than Kail Pendragon, but mine is quite different as i go for the power of the Divine.

Select whatever pleases you more, both are extremly powerful in a lvl 20 environment.

posts.author: an ominous cow herd
posts.content: I played a build similar to your second one, and it was indeed powerful and capable of soloing most encounters as long as he had some Turn Undead uses available. I went with a high charisma build, and took all the paladin levels first to get the buff spells as soon as possible. If I had to do it again, I'd go with a more balanced stat spread like your first build.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Yeah, i was playing on Thain and that's where i saw for first time a solid builded Paladin with a CHA focus. In a lvl 20 environment those Divine feats along with the Paladin spells were so uber he literally took out Bosses all by himself. For those that haven't experianced something like that, it is like a superman mode ON. I agree with you, i would go too with my first build but i put there the second for those that want a little more security, Wands crafting is also so nice for him because he can't have the spell slots the first one has.
